name: Swallow to Survive
description:
Being disabled or chronically ill and maintaining your standard of living can mean having to take a lot of pills! Medicines, painkillers, anti-inflammatories, supplements, and so on. And some mornings this can be quite the challenge, with it feeling like they're getting stuck in your throat, or making you feel nauseous. 

Other days, they slide down easily and you take a moment to wonder, are you demonic enough to try dry swallowing them tomorrow? Or is that merely hubris waiting to strike you down? 

This is a super basic racing game, made using a Brackey's tutorial as a learning project, influenced by my daily experience taking a fistful of medications. The pill you'll be driving is, of course, PREP, because gay rights. I will not be taking further questions about that choice at this time. 

If you living in a nation with affordable healthcare, please talk to your health provider about whether or not PREP is right for you, no matter your sexuality. 

Use the A and D keys to guide the pill down your throat without triggering your gag reflex (RIP non-QWERTY keyboards, I'm sorry).
